paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the properties of the D540K mutation in the KCNH2 gene, focusing on its effects on channel gating and drug trapping by MK-499. No other variants in KCNH2 are mentioned.

functional_data.summary: The D540K mutation in KCNH2 alters channel gating, allowing the channel to open in response to hyperpolarization, which is not typical for wild-type HERG channels.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
variants.additional_notes: The study focuses on the functional impact of the D540K mutation on HERG channel gating and drug trapping, rather than clinical significance or patient data.
key_quotes: We recently discovered that a single missense mutation in the S4–S5 linker (LS4S5) of HERG (D540K) altered channel gating in exactly this manner.

challenges: No patient data or penetrance information was provided in the paper.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily focuses on the functional analysis of the D540K mutation in KCNH2, with no mention of other variants or clinical data.
